course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Guided Studies in Chinese Philosophical Classics
course.description: The course is a guided study of selected Chinese philosophical classics, with emphasis on the hermeneutical issues associated with the texts. The related Chinese philosophers are introduced to the students, including Mencius, Xunzi, Laozi, Zhuangzi, Mozi, Gongsun Longzi and Wang Yang-ming. Topics include: â€œthe basis of li (rites)â€, â€œthe rectification of namesâ€, â€œthe four beginningsâ€, â€œthe four metaphorsâ€, â€œevil natureâ€, â€œineffable Daoâ€, â€œthe butterflyâ€™s dreamâ€, â€œthe fishâ€™s happinessâ€, â€œwhite horse is not horseâ€, â€œthe immutability of thingsâ€, â€œthe impure nature of Buddhasâ€, â€œembracing the six qualitiesâ€ and â€œthe questions on Great Learningâ€.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Leo Kwok is a good prof. Will answer every question if you ask.
(I never ask, just listen tgt when my gpmate ask)
The teaching flow are flexible according to student's interest.
Maybe I am really not interested in Chinese philosophical classics, I fall a sleep sometimes. But when I am awake I knew that he is a good teacher. Just maybe I'm too sleepy sls.

reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy if you have good group mates or you are really interested in Chinese philosophical classics.

The present is not too difficult.
Mo midterm and final only present and essay. ok la~ in ust wor...

Weekly discussion is just a script of discussion between your gpmate. Just write sth related to the topic is fine. Not take attendance but must need to hand in weekly discussion even you are not class.

Essay is not difficult, if you don't have any idea on the topic, the prof will have some suggestion topic for you.
Require reading material he will talk about it every lesson, but i never pre-read it. He will talk about it super clear during class.
Read it if you want A+? maybe

My result:
èª²å¾Œç ”è¨ï¼š19.13 /20  (Mean 14.78, High: 20)
åˆ†çµ„å ±å‘Šï¼š24/30  ( Mean  21.85 , High: 26 )
è«–æ–‡ï¼š47/50  ( Mean: 37.4 High: 48)

Grade: A

You can see that the project score is very close for every student. Your independent work is the most important part of the grading.
Please work hard for the discussion question and the essay.

To a student that has no competitive background in Chinese literature, I think the grading is satisfactory and generous. Most of the students I know get good grades (B, B+, A-) even with bad scores. But I think it is very hard to get an A+ or A.


**** Tips for the essay writing

Professor always reminds us to "think critically" and "compare the philosophical theory with the modern world". A philosophy essay shouldn't be like a history essay. Please bear in mind that.

**** Tips for the discussion question

Professor will really check your answer and read every student's work in detail. So you have to be serious about every discussion. If you really have no idea about the discussion question, you can just google it and add some personal opinion. The discussion work should not be too long. Highly recommend you to type your word in a word document with your groupmates and show your response to their opinions.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Good teaching, clear and logical.
Active class participation and the instructor is responsive to students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair, tends to be good.
85% A+, 65% C+, no one fails in the whole class.
reviews.comment_workload: A written report + An essay final exam + Class participation, Attendance
